title: Real Estate Broker/Manager
description:
Job Summary

A Real Estate Broker Manager is responsible for overseeing and developing a team of real estate agents to achieve sales and performance objectives. This role involves strategic planning, sales management, team leadership, and client relationship management.

Responsibilities

* **Sales Management:**
* Develop and implement sales strategies to increase market share and revenue.
* Set and monitor sales targets for the agent team.
* Analyze sales performance data and identify areas for improvement.
* Provide coaching and mentorship to agents to enhance sales skills.
* **Team Leadership:**
* Recruit, hire, and onboard new agents.
* Develop and implement training programs to improve agent knowledge and skills.
* Conduct performance reviews and provide feedback to agents.
* Foster a positive and collaborative team environment.
* **Market Analysis:**
* Analyze local real estate market trends and conditions.
* Identify potential opportunities and challenges.
* Develop strategies to capitalize on market trends.
* **Operational Management:**
* Ensure compliance with real estate regulations and company policies.
* Manage agent licensing and certifications.
* Oversee daily operations and administrative tasks.
* Manage office budgets and expenses.
* **Business Development:**
* Identify and pursue new business opportunities.
* Develop marketing and promotional materials.
* Build and maintain relationships with industry partners.

Qualifications

* Proven experience in real estate sales management and team leadership.
* In-depth knowledge of the local real estate market.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to analyze data and make informed decisions.
* Strong organizational and time management skills.
* Real estate broker's license.
* Bachelor's degree preferred.

Compensation and Desired Skills

* Proficiency in real estate CRM software.
* Experience in coaching and mentoring.
* Strong negotiation skills.
* Effective problem-solving and conflict resolution skills.
* This is commission share position only

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

License/Certification:

* New Jersey Broker Real Estate License (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Hillsborough, NJ (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Full Charge Bookkeeper
description:
```Duties:```  
- Perform full-cycle bookkeeping duties, including but not limited to accounts payable, accounts receivable, and general ledger reconciliation.  
- Enter purchases and monitor inventory levels in accounting system  
- Record transactions using online portal access for customer systems  
- Record transactions using online portal access for vendor systems  
- Ensure compliance with accounting principles and company policies.  
- Collaborate with management to develop financial strategies and goals.

```Skills:```  
- Strong knowledge of accounting principles and financial concepts.  
- Proficiency in using accounting software, QuickBooks Enterprise, including Advanced Inventory.  
- Experience with balance sheet reconciliation and general ledger reconciliation.  
- Ability to perform vendor account and customer account reconciliation accurately and efficiently.  
- Excellent 10-key typing skills for data entry.  
- Familiarity with Amazon sales portal and applying customer credits and charges.  
- Previous experience in manufacturing or consumer product distribution a plus

We are seeking a detail-oriented individual who is highly organized and has a strong understanding of bookkeeping principles. The ideal candidate will have excellent analytical skills and the ability to work independently. This is a great opportunity for someone looking to further their career in finance and accounting.

Please note that this is not an entry-level position. Prior experience as a full charge bookkeeper or in a similar role is required.

If you meet the qualifications outlined above, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume along with a cover letter detailing your relevant experience.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $47,836.49 - $57,609.54 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Supplemental Pay:

* Performance bonus

Work Location: In person
